ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Ethnicity of participant
ValueRange: Hispanic or Latino; Not Hispanic or Latino; Unknown

ElementDescription: Race of study subject
ValueRange: American Indian/Alaska Native; Asian; Hawaiian or Pacific Islander; Black or African American; White; More than one race; Unknown or not reported; Other Non-White; Other

ElementDescription: specify other race
Notes: The following questions are about you or the child's family.

ElementDescription: handedness
Notes: R = Right; L = Left; B = Both; 999= No Answer; 888= Skipped; 777= Condition Skipped; 555= Missing

ElementDescription: If child is currently in school, what grade is your child in?
What type of school does your child attend?
Notes: 1= Regular public school; 2= Regular private school; 3= Special school for children with emotional/behavioral problems; 4= Special school for children with learning disabilities; 5= Home school; 99= Other

ElementDescription: why type of school does your child attend_other
Notes: If 7 (other), what is the type of school the child attends?

ElementDescription: What is the highest level of education completed by your child's mother?
Notes: 0= No school; 1= Less than seven years of school; 2= Less than High School graduate; 3= Junior High school (7th, 8th, 9th); 4= Some High school (10th, 11th); 5= High School graduate (or completed equivalency); 6= Completed some college or technical school or Associates degree (at least one year); 7= College graduate; 8= Graduate professional training (Masters degree or above); 99= Don't know

ElementDescription: In the current household, which of the following best describes the mother's (mother figure) current employment status?
Notes:
1 = Working full time
2 = Working part time
3 = Unemployed, looking for work
4 = Unemployed, not looking for work
5 = Keeping house
6 = Disabled
7 = Retired
8 = Student, full time
9 = Student, part time
10 = Other
62 = Disabled and working part time
81 = Student full time and working full time
82 = Student full time and working part time
91 = Student part time and working full time

ElementDescription: Mother/surrogate occupation
Notes: 0=N/A; 1=farm laborers/menial service workers/welfare recipients; 2=unskilled workers; 3=machine operators/semi skilled workers; 4=smaller business owners/skilled manual workers/craftsmen/tenant farmers; 5=clerical and sales workers/small farm and business owners; 6=technicians/semi professionals/small business owners; 7=small business owners/farm owners/managers/minor professionals; 8=administrators/lesser professionals/proprietors of medium sized businesses; 9=higher executives/proprietors of large businesses/major professionals
